articles.content:
Special Write-ups Posted on U.S. Internet Homepage 
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The U.S. Group for the Study of Songun Politics posted a special write-up on its internet homepage "Room for the study of red sun under militant socialism of Juche" on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 The homepage carried portraits of the three generals of Mt. Paektu and photos showing the revolutionary activities of the peerlessly great men and great woman including a photo of President Kim Il Sung standing on Mt. Paektu together with leader Kim Jong Il.
 It edited instructions given by Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il on thoroughly establishing Juche in the revolution and construction, adhering to independence, intensifying the struggle against imperialism and the U.S., consolidating the national defense capability and waging a staunch struggle against modern revisionism and other materials.    
 It also carried aphorisms of Kim Jong Il on the revolutionary view on the leader, philosophy, viewpoint and attitude toward the people and the role of ideology, etc, under the title "Aphorisms reflecting the brilliant wisdom of the respected general Kim Jong Il."

articles.content:
DPRK Red Cross Delegation Leaves for Seoul 
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Red Cross Society headed by Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the C.C., the DPRK Red Cross Society, left here today to attend the 15th general meeting and the meeting of the council of delegates of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies to be held in Seoul. 
 It was seen off at the airport by Min Pyong Gwan, secretary general of the C.C., the DPRK Red Cross Society, and officials concerned.

articles.title: DPRK Delegation to Six-Party Talks Leaves for China
articles.content:
DPRK Government Cultural Delegation Leaves for China 
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government cultural delegation headed by Vice-Minister of Culture Choe Chang Il left here today to participate in the forum of Asian cultural ministers to be held in China.
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by Vice-Minister of Culture Sim Tong Gol and Cultural Councilor of the Chinese embassy here Zhang Yongwen.

articles.title: KCNA Refutes U.S. Anti-DPRK Human Rights Campaign
articles.content:
DPRK Delegation to Six-Party Talks Leaves for China
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A DPRK delegation headed by Kim Kye Gwan, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, left here today to participate in the six-party talks on the nuclear issue between the DPRK and the U.S. to be held in Beijing.
 It was seen off at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Yong Il, officials concerned, Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe and Russian Charge d' Affaires a.i. Oleg Davydov.

articles.content:
Decision of the 57th Meeting of Council of Korea-China Hydroelectric Power Company Signed
    Beijing, November 7 (KCNA) -- A decision of the 57th meeting of the Council of the Korea-China Hydroelectric Power Company was signed in Beijing on Monday. 
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were members of the DPRK delegation headed by Vice-Minister of Electricity and Coal Industries Sin Yong Song who is managing director of the council of the DPRK and Choe Jin Su, DPRK ambassador to China, and from the Chinese side members of the Chinese delegation headed by Zheng Baoshen, deputy director general of the China State Electric Network Corporation, who is managing director of the council of China.

articles.title: Greetings to Cambodian King
articles.content:
Russian Foreign Ministry Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Russian Foreign Ministry led by its Vice-Minister Aleksandr Alekseyev left here today after wrapping up its 4 day-visit to the DPRK.
 During its stay the delegation visited Mangyongdae and laid bouquets at the Liberation Tower. It looked round the construction site of the Jongbaek Church now nearing completion in east Pyongyang.

articles.title: Greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Cambodian King
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Cambodian King Norodom Sihamoni on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of its independence.
 The message said that the Korean people are sincerely rejoiced over the great successes made by the Cambodian people in their work to build a new society, independent and prosperous, true to the noble intention of His Majesty the Great King Norodom Sihanouk under the leadership of the Cambodian king and government.    
 Expressing the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation based on the particularly fraternal relations between President Kim Il Sung and respected His Majesty the Great King Norodom Sihanouk would continue to grow strong in various fields in the future, too, the message sincerely wished the king good health and greater success in his efforts to accomplish the noble cause of building a new society.

articles.title: Delegation of Korean Traders and Industrialists in Japan Here
articles.content:
Greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Cambodian Prime Minister Hun Sen on the occasion of the 52nd anniversary of its independence.
 Expressing the belief that the traditional friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop, the message wished the people of the Kingdom of Cambodia new progress and prosperity.    
 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent a similar message to Deputy Prime Minister Hor Nam Hong who is concurrently minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation.

articles.title: Spokesman for DPRK FM. Refutes U.S. Chief Executive's Anti-DPRK Vituperation
articles.content:
Delegation of Korean Traders and Industrialists in Japan Here
    Pyongyang, November 8 (KCNA) -- A delegation of Korean traders and industrialists in Japan advised by Ryang Su Jong, vice-chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, and headed by Ri Pong Guk, chairman of the Federation of Korean Traders and Industrialists in Japan, arrived here today to visit the socialist homeland on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the formation of the FKTIJ. 
 It was greeted at the airport by Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the DPRK Cabinet, and Kim Yu Ho, director of the Agency of Service for Overseas Compatriots of Korea.
